content.2: And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil:
content.3: And thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
content.4: And Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shalt wash them with water.
content.5: And thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron the coat, and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the curious girdle of the ephod:
content.6: And thou shalt put the mitre upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the mitre.
content.7: Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour
content.8: And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.
content.9: And thou shalt gird them with girdles, Aaron and his sons, and put the bonnets on them: and the priest’s office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute: and thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons.
content.10: And thou shalt cause a bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.

content.15: Thou shalt also take one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.

content.26: And thou shalt take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s consecration, and wave it
content.27: And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of the consecration,
content.28: And it shall be Aaron’s and his sons’ by a statute for ever from the children of Israel: for it
content.29: And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed therein, and to be consecrated in them.
content.31: And thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.

content.33: And they shall eat those things wherewith the atonement was made, to consecrate
content.34: And if ought of the flesh of the consecrations, or of the bread, remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it
content.35: And thus shalt thou do unto Aaron, and to his sons, according to all
content.36: And thou shalt offer every day a bullock
content.37: Seven days thou shalt make an atonement for the altar, and sanctify it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatsoever toucheth the altar shall be holy.
content.39: The one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even:
content.40: And with the one lamb a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil; and the fourth part of an hin of wine
content.41: And the other lamb thou shalt offer at even, and shalt do thereto according to the meat offering of the morning, and according to the drink offering thereof, for a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the
content.43: And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and
content.44: And I will sanctify the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar: I will sanctify also both Aaron and his sons, to minister to me in the priest’s office.
content.45: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.
